36427968.review:
[h1] Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock is an average sci-fi point and click that is worth it on sale [/h1]

Another unplayed point and click sitting in my library. I thought the game was more or less straightforward. I dislike it when solutions in point and clicks make little sense. Also, they actually implemented a hint system with the radio! More games need to do this! It's nice to have that option for those moments when you've got no time for a game's BS. The soundtrack fit the setting which I appreciated. My two main cons were the length and the voice acting. Novak's voice sounded fine to me, but Powell's voice was so robotic and cheesy. It was distracting how bad it was. Regarding the length, I only clocked in about 2 hours total. I was expecting 3-4 hours. The story felt rushed, and I wanted more explanation. What were the aliens'/robots' intentions? What did that one dead alien look like? Questions like that. I'm also tired of this sci-fi trope. Humans crash on a planet and find aliens who lure people in to destroy them. If anyone is interested in a better sci-fi point and click game, I'd recommend J.U.L.I.A.: Among the Stars.

Regardless, I think Morningstar was a decent game for the price I paid (about $1.60). There are no jump scares, although the red eyes spooked me.

30230440.review:
[i]Morningstar[/i] is a point-and-click adventure in the classic model.  It offers a brief, modest challenge, without artifically inflating the difficulty through illogical puzzles or pesky pixel-hunting.  It has cinematics and voice acting that are astonishingly good for a budget game.  The primary weakness is that, by never significantly stymieing the player's progress, the game runs its course pretty quickly.  You can expect to get through the entire thing in a single sitting, and there is, naturally, no replayability.

If you're okay with a game that can only give you about an hour of playtime, [i]Morningstar[/i] will give you an enjoyable and well-crafted hour.  If you insist on more playtime for your buck, look elsewhere.

29574840.review:
A fun little point-and-click in the vein of [i]J.U.L.I.A.: Among the Stars[/i]. You're a space merchant by the name of Powell who has crash-landed on the desert planet Deadrock. Since your captain, Novak, is injured, you must find a way to heal him and fix the ship on your own by braving the desert landscape in search for the necessary parts. However, there's more to Deadrock than meets the eye, as you soon come across another ship that has met the same fate as yours and slowly begin to uncover the fate that befell it and its crew. Will you share that same fate?

Like [i]J.U.L.I.A.[/i], the mystery is what keeps you going in this game. The puzzles themselves are not that difficult to solve and there's the usual amount of backtracking. Unlike [i]J.U.L.I.A.[/i] however, this game is short (it took me less than 2 hours to complete), probably shorter than it should be to thoroughly explore the mystery surrounding Deadrock and get the full picture of what happened to the crew of the Armstrong (the other ship you come across). In particular, as you get closer to the ending of the game an event occurs that suggests one of them might have (recently) uncovered the secret of Deadrock but nothing comes of it; it's another mystery that will probably never be solved.

Voiceover in this game ranges from bad to acceptable but the humor makes it tolerable. If there was a soundtrack to this game, it wasn't particularly memorable as I don't recall it. From the technical standpoint, I was fearful at first by the barebones main menu that featured no settings to adjust (no display/graphics options, no keybindings) and my fears were later justified as I played: the keyboard is useless in this game; I couldn't even use the Esc key to switch between the ingame menu and the game itself. Even the mouse felt a little underconfigured for my tastes, as gameplay comes down to using the left-click at all times (can't even right-click to backtrack).

In short, if you have a couple of hours of free time and are looking for a point-and-click space adventure, [i]Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock[/i] fits the bill. However, I would recommend you wait for a discount in order to get it. I myself bought it during Steam's 2016 Winter Sale at 75% off. Doubtless it will be discounted again.

29437043.review:
[h1]A great sci-fi point-n-click adventure game where puzzles actually make sense.[/h1]

Not only did the puzzles in the game make sense, they were all very doable.  Though there was one spot I had to refer to a guide -- I missed a tiny item I needed to pick up to move the story along, so that's my fault for missing it.

One unique aspect in this game that I really liked was how you can mouse over a scene and it will highlight what you can interact with, whether it's an item you can search, something you pick up, or the adjoining location to travel to, etc.

Overall, I thought the story was great with nice graphics, setting, and style.  Granted, the voice acting is generally terrible and even comically bad at times, but overall I still welcomed the spoken dialog and the game itself remained thoroughly enjoyable.  The game even has a nice hint system for when you want it by way of radio'ing back to your Captain and he tells you what you're supposed to be doing.

[h1]Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed the quick 2.4hr game to completion and highly recommend it.  8 out of 10.[/h1]

28799088.review:
It was short, but I didn't actually noticed it until the game ended. I was truly immersed into the ambience. The background music was perfect. The vocal interaction between the PC and NPC were very well done.

Unlike many games of the genre, I really like the hint system. It's vague enough to give me room to think what I need to do next, but specific enough to point me in the general direction. 

There is also not much back tracking, which is huge in many other adventure point and click games. I prefer it this way. 

Throughout the game, there are hints that there will be more to the story. So by the time the outro started playing, it left me to think about them. Like what's up with [spoiler]that star system with the single planet[/spoiler]? Who [spoiler]killed the alien in the hidden room[/spoiler]?

I hope there will be more to this title. It has definitely intrigued me.

28549318.review:
The voice acting is what keeps this game so enjoyable for its 2-3 hour runtime. The often funny banter between the two main characters keeps the game from becoming a boring search for progression, and it's honestly pretty well written. I loved the badass ending sequence. Really made finishing the game satisfying.

The puzzle solving within the game itself is sometimes esoteric, but clever. It's not too easy, and you actually have to use your brain to find solutions many times, it's not possible to completely brute force, but it isn't painfully obscure in solutions either. Finding your way off this "deserted" alien planet ends up being quite a good time. My friend who doesn't play these sort of games watched me and we had a good time trying to figure out how to progress, so it seems even if you aren't a fan of point and clicks games, this one can be enjoyable regardless. Give it a try.

Симпатичная неяркая (дань атмосфере игры) графика. Понятные логичные задачки. Сюжет присутствует. Ненавязчивый грубоватый, но не тупой юмор космобродяг.
Игра короткая, но больше, наверное, и не нужно. Эпичное крсивое видео в конце. В общем, отдых для души, мозгов и глаз. Советую.

28125753.review:
Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock is a very good point and click adventure where you must explore areas of an alien planet in order to repair your crashed ship and save yourself and your captain.

The immersion factor is high, despite the static screens. It is refreshing to play a P&C game where the puzzles are logical for the most part, requiring thought as opposed to madly trying every inventory object on everything. The game world feels realistic within the realm of intelligent science fiction. For the most part, the voiceovers (the player character and the injured captain) are solid with only the occassional odd line reading. 

One caveat for prospective buyers is that the game is relatively short; I achieved 100% in three hours, and I don't believe any achievements are missable. However, I feel that this is actually a good thing; the game doesn't feel bloated with ridiculous puzzles and there's hardly any backtracking. The MSRP of ten dollars is definitely worth it for the experience, especially compared to the price of a movie ticket and the length of a typical movie.

There is a demo available (and a free Flash version of the original), so if the premise and trailer appeal to you, there's no risk to try before you buy.

28094345.review: Fantastic game. Played it twice now.  Story is good, voice acting great and the puzzels are challenging yet fun. Both times I had to play the game straight through.

If you like adventures you will like this!

26052468.review:
Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock is a decent, enjoyable first person adventure.  

Morningstar is the sort of game that most people (or most point-and-click adventure fans) should be able to agree upon, at least broadly.  I doubt many would claim that it's one of the top tier adventure games, but it's certainly a good one.  It has an enjoyable story, appealing graphics, and nice music.  Every achievement is easily attainable.  The gameplay generally isn't difficult and there is a built-in hint system, but there are a few illogical puzzles that might trip you up for a bit.

The quick pace is generally to the game's advantage, but the most negative aspect of the game is it's pricing.  Ten USD is a steep price for any 2~ hour game, and Morningstar is solid rather than a masterpiece.  As a game without a lot of replayability (there are very few unnecessary diversions or exploration to be had), I would wait for a sale to buy this one.

26029230.review:
Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock - это короткий квест о двух астронавтах, потерпевших крушение на никому неизвестной планете. 
Игра очень простая. Я всегда находил квесты слишком скучными, но загадки в этой игре не требуют большого ума. На самом деле собственно загадок лишь несколько, остальное время мы комбинируем и применяем предметы. Обшаривать экран мышком в поисках потерянной отвертки игроку тоже не прийдется. Достаточно поводить курсором по экрану и все активные зоны подсветятся. Если совсем застрянуть, то всегда можно связаться по радио со своим напарником, который даст ценный совет.
В техническом плане игра выполнена отлично. Задники красивые, а персонажи озвучены хорошо. Роликов мало, но и они сделаны на довольно высоком уровне.
Учитывая все это получилась очень качественная игра, а два часа потраченные на нее пролетели не заметно.

原作是2009年的免費網頁遊戲，當年就非常讓我驚豔。作為一款點擊解謎類型的遊戲，氣氛營造的非常好，劇情雖短但也相當不錯。

25706410.review:
$10 seems a bit much for a game that I completed in less than 2 hrs.  And it in general it was a lack luster experience.  The puzzles which impede your progress are too easy to really be considered puzzles.  Easily find a thing and put it on the obvious hotspot.  There was some hope of decoding an alien language toward the end, but all you really have to decode is on and off which I figured out by looking at the first alien console.  So, it didn't take much brain power.  

Considering the dearth of puzzles, I thought about regarding it more along the lines of interactive fiction.  But it's just all stuff we've seen countless times before there.  I was particularly reminded of the episode of Battlestar Galactica where Starbuck crash lands on an alien world and has to hot wire a Cylon drone to get away.

I would like more sci fi adventure games, but I'm not going to give this a good review just because of the genres it's a part of.

There weren't any single pixel objects hidden anywhere, and once you found an interaction point, it was always highlighted.

The puzzles, while not always making complete sense (I'm looking at you, gas mask and beer) weren't too hard to figure out from the verbal clues.

Even if you do get stuck there's a radio (aka Hint) button to assist you with what you're trying to do.

The worst part was the weird euro-english voice acting, but I've definitely heard worse.

Check it out!

Oh, uno de los género perdidos, los point & click se han perdido a través de los años por que los tiempos cambian, pero creo que son un género que debería volver, ¿por qué? por juegos cómo éste, pues la historia es tan cautivadora, bien hecha, tan bien contada y concreta, en la cual, somos un astronauta cuya nave se estrella en un planeta que está tachado de peligroso, la tripulación se encuentra malherida y algunos muertos, encarnamos al único astronauta que pudo salvarse bien. teniendo la responsabilidad de arreglar la nave, salir del planeta a cómo de lugar mientras desentrañas el misterio del planeta.
BUENO:

Jednym zdaniem: Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock to rasowa kosmiczna przygodówka SF, która przypomniała mi najlepsze stare gry sprzed lat, takie jak np. słynna Dune z 1992 roku. Od lat nie było kosmicznej przygodówki z tak dobrym klimatem.

Plusy:

+ fajne dynamiczne intro wprowadzające do gry
+ gra elegancka wizualnie i bardzo estetycznie zaprojektowana 
+ pustynna planeta, jak i wnętrza statku są bardzo klimatycznie przedstawione 
+ bardzo wygodny interfejs, co nie zawsze się zdarza w point and click
+ zagadki w grze nie są niepotrzebnie skomplikowane 
+ jeżeli się zatniemy w grze, to bardzo pomaga opcja podpowiedzi pilota przez radio :)
+ dobre efekty dźwiękowe w grze 
+ ambientowa muzyka podkreśla kosmiczny klimat izolacji
+ dobre tempo narracji w grze (nie pozwala się nudzić)
+ gra fabularnie i klimatycznie podobna trochę do książki Lema pt. Niezwyciężony

Minusy: 

- kiepski tytuł, który naprawdę trudno zapamiętać
- amatorskie, beznamiętnie podłożone głosy (najgorszy ten głównego bohatera)
- trochę drętwe poczucie humoru
- fabuła pod koniec ma pewne luki (wiele rzeczy jest niewyjaśnionych)
- gra trochę zbyt krótka jak na swój potencjał
- finał jest dość przeciętny i nie budzi emocji

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam?

+ polecam fanom klasycznych przygodówek point and click, w których nie ma ryzyka śmierci
+ polecam tym, którzy zagrywali się w Diunę z 1992 roku, bo tu jest podobny pustynny klimat 
+ polecam wielbicielom izolacji w kosmosie typu rozbitek na obcej planecie
- odradzam jedynie fanom strzelanek z kosmitami, bo tutaj tego nie znajdziecie

Rada: 

Jeżeli chcesz przeżyć przygodę w kosmosie w starym przygodówkowym stylu, to Morningstar jest zdecydowanie dla Ciebie.

24900877.review:
Like many other fellow Steam gamers, I played this game when it first came out on Kongregate all those years ago.
Boy, this game was THE shit back then, and I distinctly remember puzzling through the challenges at every stage.

For me, this is one of the classics - a point-and-click adventure that does not try to go beyond its scope, and remains focused on a set goal established at the beginning of the game that stays unchanged even with new elements of intrigue. I strongly appreciate how the protagonist does not try to find the backstories and home addresses of every goddamn alien or how to kill them, and simply tries to find a way home. That being said, the protagonist is the ultimate Jesus MacGyver of putting things together, he'd probably be able to clear Dark Souls 3 with a thread and a stick.

Playing through the game again, and hooooooly fuck how much the game has improved. Art, sound, voice, gameplay, these things took steroids and then some. Absolutely amazing to take this trip down memory lane again. I really appreciated the game back when I was a kid, and I'm repaying those hours of excitement by buying this on Steam.

TL;DR
Holy balls nostalgia/10

Storyline - 9/10
Art/Animation - 10/10
Sounds/Music - 10/10
Ambience/Feeling/Other - 9/10

Overal rating: 9.5/10

At $10 it might be one of those on-the-line games for some people, but it is a rewarding, great experience and some legitimately good fun.

24273108.review:
Отличный Point & Click, с нотками мистики и загадки. 

Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock - это игра на пару-тройку прохождений, но однозначно с ней можно приятно провести время. Красивая графика, приятная музыка, увлекательный сюжет. Местами игра будоражит воображение, заставляя притаить дыхание. Сюжет необычный для такого жанра. Космический корабль терпит крушение и Вам необходимо сделать всё возможное, чтобы спасти капитана и себя. Но продвигаясь всё ближе к заветному спасению, понимаете, что не всё так просто.

Игра пошла на среднем ПК, без вылетов и прочего. Русификатор был взят из руководства и отлично установился. Без русского языка изначально сложно было понять речь и что именно от Вас хотят. Много слов связанно с космическими деталями, техникой и прочим, что затрудняло продвижение в игре. 

В целом:
1) Достижения простые, выдадутся все при прохождении до конца.
2) Графика/музыка приятная
3) Увлекательный сюжет
4) Запускается на средних ПК без вылетов
5) Рекомендована для скачки/покупки

23722731.review:
[h1]概要[/h1]
　宇宙船の事故で不時着した未知の惑星からの脱出を目指すオーソドックスなポイント&クリック方式のSFアドベンチャーゲームです。
　対応言語は英語のみで、ボイスには字幕がつきますが一時停止できず、会話に合わせて流れていってしまいます。ログなども残らないので会話を全て理解するにはそこそこの英語力が必要かと思います。とはいえゲームの内容はさほど複雑ではないので、会話を聞き漏らしても状況は把握でき、ゲームも問題なく進められると思います。分かり安く聞き取りやすい英語で話してくれるので助かります。

[h1]ゲームについて[/h1]
　ごく一般的なポイント&クリック式のアドベンチャーゲームです。探索とアイテムの収集と利用がメインで、パズルゲームなどのようなものはありません。
　不時着した宇宙船の乗組員は主人公を含め3名で、一人は不時着時に死亡。もう一人は一命を取り留めたものの重傷で動けず、行動できるのは主人公のみという状況から始まります。この生き残った同僚が有能で、画面下の「RADIO」のボタンを押すといつでもどこでも連絡が取れ、的確なアドバイスをしてくれますので小まめに連絡を取りましょう。
　このゲームでは手持ちのアイテムを組み合わせて新しいアイテムを作ることができます。使える組み合わせを探すのがこのゲームで一番頭を使うところだと思います。宇宙を舞台にしたサバイバルで、使える物であれこれ工夫をして困難に立ち向かうところは映画「アポロ13」を思い浮べました。
　後半まで気づきませんでしたが、マウスホイールでもアイテム一覧をスクロールできるのでアイテムが増えてきた時には便利です。
　ストーリーのボリュームは1時間のテレビシリーズ1話くらいで、プレイ時間は3～4時間くらいだと思います。仲間との会話や主人公の独り言の中にあちこちヒントがちりばめられているので難易度はそれほど高くないと思います。詰ってしまった場合でも公式の[url=steamcommunity.com/app/339130/discussions/0/610573009240240153/]walkthrough(攻略法)[/url]が公開させれているので問題ないと思います。

[h1]感想[/h1]
　雰囲気やストーリーはSF映画そのままの感じで間延びした所もなく、ちょっと悩むところはありますが、基本的にはサクサク進み最後まで飽きずに楽しめました。一本のストーリーしてはきれいにまとまっていますがボリュームは少なく、語られずに終わる部分が多く、ちょっと食い足りない感じがしますが、値段相応といったところでしょうか。
　Steamの実績やトレーディングカードにも対応しています。ゲームをクリアしすれば実績は全て揃います。トレーディングカードもゲームをクリアした頃には全て排出されていると思いますので、実績&トレーディングカードマニアにもお勧めできます。

Perfekt gemachtes SciFi Point-and-Click Abenteuer.
Vorspann und Abspann sind zudem allererste Sahne,
während der Vorspann perfekt auf das zu erlebende Abenteuer einstimmt,
belohnt einen dann der Abspann für einige Stunden der Rätselmühen auf eine sehr befriedigende Art und Weise!
Die Rätsel sind und bleiben stets völlig logisch und nachvollziehbar,
abstrakt verknotete "das-darf-doch-wohl-nicht-wahr-sein-was haben-die-Entwickler-denn-bloss-wieder-schlechtes-geraucht-Rätsel" wird man in diesem Spiel bestimmt nicht finden, und das ist auch sehr gut so.
Stets fair und motivierend geht es dem Finale entgegen, 
während man - dem atmosphärischen Soundtrack und der klarst verständlichen englischen Sprachausgabe gebannt lauschend - in dem nur einen nötigen Durchgang mit 16 schönen Errungenschaften mehr als nur befriedigend für das Rätselknacken entlohnt wird.
Ein 100%iges Daumen-hoch von mir, und ein Nachfolger wäre meinerseits wohl ein gar-nicht-nicht-mehr-weiter-zu-überlegender Pflichtkauf!

21780949.review:
Morningstar n'est pas un grand jeu. Pas un mauvais, mais peut-être pas un bon non plus. Court, sans ambition et générique,  il est une relique issue du monde du jeu gratuit en flash où il ne brillait que par sa plastique, émeraude au royaume des galets peints devenue banale ailleurs que sur un navigateur web. Le syndrome smartphone au carré. Mais. Mais ses qualités. Mais son histoire simple, intelligible qui ne nous place pas au centre des enjeux intergalactiques ou spatio-temporels, donc l'immersion. Mais sa saveur de jeu d'aventure à la première personne d'il y a vingt ans. Mais sa facilité parfaite qui nous invite à progresser doucement le long de ses deux ou trois heures de durée de vie. La tranquillité d'une promenade. Mais, de l'autre côté du hublot, un panorama inquiétant. Dehors, le silence. L'ennui peut-être. Mais le plaisir primitif des énigmes bien faites. Mais, abandonnés ici ou là, quatre ou cinq journaux de bord écrits par des poignets tremblants, mais ces cadavres éparpillés sur ma route, témoins de l'hostilité d'un environnement que je crains de plus en plus. La monotonie du décor. Mais l'épaisse couche de sombre dans lequel se noient les ventres des carcasses de vaisseaux piégés sur le dos d'une planète dont personne n'est jamais revenu. Mais le jaune aveuglant du dehors, d'un sable qui a été le lit de tellement de carnages, mais l'horreur en plein jour. Mais des dizaines de statues érigées en arcs de cercles dans le cul d'une crevasse comme les étudiants d'un amphithéâtre en plein air, comme les spectateurs d'un opéra de sourds ou, pourquoi pas, les complices d'un complot muet. Les dunes, les couloirs de rouille, les statues, le paysage tout entier me regarde, m'étudie, me jauge. La sensation d'être peut-être la proie d'une menace invisible.

Non, Morningstar n'est pas un grand jeu. Mais il cumule les bons points, les raisons de lui offrir un euro et une après-midi. Une mésaventure salutaire parce que banale, une production moyenne réhaussée par le coup de pouce de l'imagination. C'est l'histoire d'un accident, le récit d'une survie, le plaisir d'un vieux point & click bien fait. Rien de plus.

21708114.review:
This was just ok. I purchased this in the hopes of finding a spacey adventure game with an intense atmosphere like that of [i]The Dig[/i] (both involve mostly solitary exploration of strange, desolate alien environments), but was left distinctly underwhelmed by the game in general. 

It's diverting enough, with sufficient mileage to absorb somewhat for a few hours, but the plot and characters are basic and lacklustre. There's also no real climax/resolution to the game--while there's a confrontation, it's expected and occurs as a cut scene that is over quite quickly, so there's no real sense of being in actual danger at any point or discovery of anything truly shocking. The voice acting is rather poor, with some lines read as though the actor doesn't fully understand their context. 

On the plus side, the environments are nice to look at (although largely static--the only other character in the game doesn't move) and the puzzles are generally logical and don't require very large leaps of logic, presenting some challenges, although they're not particularly sophisticated or imaginative, either.

Overall, an easygoing, but ultimately forgettable, few hours.

[i]For more video game reviews and posts, please check out my blog at http://inkysquiggles.blogspot.co.uk.[/i]

21683989.review:
I don't like pre-rendered graphics with a single point of view for each scene. Makes me feel trapped.
I don't like disappearing intrest markers in point-and-click games. It has me sweeping the screen looking for points when I'm stuck, and that's just frustrating.
I don't like dodgy voice acting. It makes the whole game feel fake and ruins immersion.
I don't like short games, as they tend to leave me wanting more.

So, why am I recommending short a 2D pre-rendered point-and-click game with disappearing intrest markers and dodgy voice acting?

Because it's worth it. The puzzles are logical, the graphics are good, the animations servicable and the atmosphere great.
The fact that it's short is a good thing, actually. It makes it so the voice acting never gets on my nerves, and the game doesn't outstay it's welcome.

At the end, I was satisfied. I'd love to explore more, but then I'd need a free-moving camera, and voice actors that aren't simply reading. I need actors to act.

Maybe not the 9,99€ asking price, but as part of a bundle it was certainly worth my time.

[h1]Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock - arriverez-vous à survivre après votre crash sur une planète inconnue ?[/h1]

Ce jeu m’a très agréablement surpris. C’est un jeu d’aventure de type point & click. C’est de la science-fiction. L’histoire se déroule dans un futur assez lointain.

Vous êtes le seul survivant suite au crash de votre vaisseau spatial sur une planète désertique. Le capitaine a été transpercé par une barre en métal. Votre première mission est de sécuriser le vaisseau en bouchant les fissures, la seconde est de soigner le capitaine. Une fois que tout cela sera fait, il faudra s’occuper de réparer le vaisseau pour quitter cette planète.

La réalisation du jeu est excellente et c’est vraiment un plaisir d’y jouer. Si vous aimez ce genre de jeu (aventure et point & click), je ne peux que vous le conseiller.

21331783.review: This is quite an atmospheric point and click sci-fi adventure game with some nice art; explore, find interactive elements in the scene, and use / combine items that you find to solve various problems. It reminds me of those hidden object games, but without those cluttered "a bomb just went off in this cupboard and I need to find my hairbrush" scenarios. It works because it's logical; there aren't any cat mustache puzzles here, although the downside is that it's not too taxing except perhaps towards the end. It's also quite short; a couple of hours and you'll have beaten it. The music is good, the voice acting is... well, not good. In fact the protagonist sounds like a real dick, especially to his poor captain. The captain sounds like one of the devs, but at least he seems suitably weary of his arrogant co-pilot. The game is bookended by some decent cutscenes, and I think it's worthwhile if you like this kind of thing, although you might need a sale to justify the short running time.

21213561.review:
Morningstar is a fairly decent point & click foundation but sadly it has one-dimentional characters and a nonexistent story built on top of it. 

I can see why reviews here move the needle more towards the positive end of the spectrum, but what makes or breaks a P&C adventure for me isn't the puzzles or backgrounds, but the story and characters. These are the areas where Morningstar is most lacking. I didn't dislike this game as much as my thumbs down implies, but I did conclude it with a resounding, "meh."

Pros: 
-Pretty nice backgrounds and occasional animations
-Challenging, yet rewarding puzzles
-Radio "hint" system that I was grateful for

Cons:
-Weak story. You crash on a planet, you work to get off of it. There's a mystery to the planet, but you won't get to the bottom of it
-Incredibly corny and anticlimactic ending
-Voice acting varies between "hammy" and "phoning it in"

Avventura punta e clicca classica sul genere fantascienza. Siete il membro di una astronave mercantile caduta sul pianeta Deadrock(che già dal nome non promette bene), dovete riparare la vostra nave e scoprire cosa ha causato la caduta.
La trama, anche se non molto originale, resta intrigante. La grafica non è nulla di eccezionale e il comparto audio nemmeno, il gameplay invece è ben strutturato con enigmi sensati e ragionati. Si possono avere dei suggerimenti in caso, e solo un paio di volte mi è successo di pensare "a questa cosa non ci sarei mai arrivato ragionando".

Il gioco ha achievement molto facili e carte rivendibili. Dura relativamente poco ma lo consiglio vivamente.

20519531.review:
Sehr schön gezeichnetes Indie Adventure mit etwas zu kurzer Spieldauer. Die Rätsel und Kombinationen können ganz schön knackig sein und manchmal auch etwas unlogisch aber insgesamt sind sie doch alles in allem sehr gut lösbar.

Soundtechnisch sollte man nicht zu viel erwarten das beste daran sind die sarkastischen Gespräche zwischen dem Captain und einem selber. Es gibt sogar ein paar Cut-Scenes die für ein Indie Game ganz nett gemacht wurden und die gute Atmosphäre nochmals etwas steigern.

Die Geschichte von Morningstar ist dagegen mehr als rudimentär und minimal gehalten, man sollte also keine zu großen Überraschungen oder Wendungen im Verlauf erwarten.

Wer auf Adventures steht und nicht zu viel erwartet wird bei Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock ein schönes Game finden, nur den Verkaufspreis mit fast 10 Euro finde ich für die sehr kurze Spieldauer etwas zu happig, da sollte man auf einen Sale warten!

20511796.review:
I'm just gonna give this a thumbs up review because it deserves it. For all those short narrative focused games on steam  that just bore your pants off, this one nails it. Sure it's a point and click with puzzles, but they aren't crazy or outlandish like in most of the great classics, so even if you're not any good at solving puzzles in point n clicks this one should be doable. All puzzles can be solved by using plane logic (unlike so many other point and clicks), so they are easy enough. I was delighted being able to get through it without needing a guide - something I consider a good thing. 
It's fast paced and therefore doesn't get boring. You progress fast and get to see new things. The downside of this is that it's pretty short. It took me 2 and a half hours to complete. However I didn't get stuck much, so you might get some more time out of it. 
I'd recommend getting it on sale (like I did :) ) then you most likely won't regret buying it if you enjoy a nice little Sci-Fi Short Story. 
On a last note: Some review mentioned bad voice acting. Initially I would have agreed regarding the captain. But as soon as I put 1+1 together the "bad" voice acting actually added some charm to the character, seeing that he's a Russian or some other Eastern European speaking english in a flat and bored tone. It also added to the whole theme that he's an unlikeable dickhead. I thought the main characters voice acting on the other hand was decent.

Certo, la storia si conclude in 3 max 3 ore, quindi è un acquisto da fare per un prezzo ragionevole (io l'ho preso in saldo per qualche euro..), ma ti fa passare una bella serata. Consigliato!

I doubt there will be a next episode or such, and it's sad, because we learn the reason why our spaceship crashed into this planet... but many questions are left unanswered!  (no spoiler herer, it's the initial situation: you crash in the middle of nowhere on a planet no one cares about and you have to find a way to contact people, find nice guys you could stay with, go back into space... whatever the solution, just don't die in the middle of nowhere on an abandonned planet!)

[SPOILER ALERT] 
(this time you're warned)
Who built these drones? It seems there's a member of an unknown species... what about him? Did he commit suicide, so that you couldn't make him prisonner? Why not simply run away (or hide) then? If not, who killed him? If every "tube" contained a different "being"/species, what about the "specimen" that was probably in the "tube" you opened? Did it disappear into thin air?
...And many other questions.
[/SPOILER ALERT]

I liked the game, thus I cannot say I wouldn't recommend it. Just keep in mind that all in all you will live a short, somewhat frustrating but pleasant experience. Probably not worth "the full price", but defintely a good buy during sales.

Странная игра. В принципе классический поинт-клик квест, но:
1. Сюжет.
Он какой-то мягко говоря недоделанный, бестолковый, бессмысленный. Что, кто, почему, зачем - все эти вопросы остаются после ПОЛНОГО прохождения и ответа вы так и не получите. И дело на мой взгляд (сугубо личное мнение) не в том, что авторы хотели дать нам самим пофантазировать, а потому, что просто не знали как объяснить тот бред, который они сами навыдумывали (не хочу давать спойлеров, но там его немало).
2. Продолжительность. 
Ну это просто беда. Я прохожу все неторопясь, медленно, основательно. Эту игру прошел ВСЮ за 2 часа. А теперь сравните с J.U.L.I.A: Among the stars - 12 часов. И там похожий сеттинг: далекий космос, катастрофа, тайны и т.п. Но там есть нормальный сюжет, может не на пять с плюсом, но на твердую четверку, и есть что проходить - а тут маленько потыкал и все - игра пройдена.
3. Поинт-клик и головоломки. 
Слабенько. Откровенно слабенько. Причем либо совсем просто (открыть дверь, откопать могилу, зарядить ружье и т.д 98% игрового процесса), либо совершенно не очевидно, как в случае с вентилятором.
В случае с той же Julia - там на порядок лучше и интересней, я уж молчу про головоломки и копание в чужих планшетах.
4. Графика.
Терпимо. Но, если бы все предыдущие пункты были сделаны хорошо, то можно было бы и не обращать внимание на графику, а так... 

Вообщем тройка с минусом. Очень скучная и я бы сказал не атмосферная вещь. Если вы очень любите поинт-клик про космос, то можете помучиться, а так не советую.

П.С. Не понимаю, почему столько положительных отзывов, поэтому ставлю "не рекомендую", чтобы как то отличаться.
П.П.С. Русификатор есть на ZoneOfGames.ru, Morningstar...

19892692.review:
I wasn't sure what to expect going into Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock, but I will say, I was very pleasantly surprised by this title.

I'm a fan of the Point & Click genre in general.  If you've played a few games in the genre, you know what to expect; you'll wander around, collect some items, try to combine them in logical ways, and when that doesn't work, try to combine them with anything interactable.  You might encounter some logical leaps, or other mini-puzzles along the way.  If that's not for you, stay away from this title.

There's lots of this type of game available on Steam, though, so how does this one in particular stack up?

In my opinion?  Very well!

First, the atmosphere is spot on.  A sand-covered world filled with scraps of twisted metal, weird alien structures, and the corpses of the unfortunate, Deadrock gives just the right amount of sci-fi macabre I'd expect from the title.  Add in a handful of really great-looking cinematics, and you've got yourself a nice little experience.

Another major plus is the banter between your hero, and Novak, an injured smart-alec captain who serves as your point-of-contact during your exploration.  Major props to his voice actor, who got a lot more chuckles out of me than I'd expect from a game like this.

The adventure is a short one, and falls a bit on the easy side.  However, one of the reasons the game feels easy is because all of the puzzles feel like they make perfect sense, which is SO refreshing. 

 There's no BS acheivement hunting in this game; what you see is what you get, and completing the title will earn you 100%.  And that 100% will be all the sweeter because the ending of this game is without a doubt extremely satisfying.  This is definitely worth a playthrough.

19890982.review: A short, but very entertaining adventure. Puzzles demand some cleverness, while never being obtuse. The game will always inform you about what needs to be done in some way. Good design.

19538949.review:
Este jogo é excelente, bons diálogos, gráficos bonitos, puzzles bem explicados e uma ambientação boa, que realmente te faz sentir em outro planeta. Os pontos negativos ficam pelo fato do jogo ser curto, poucas animações e a parte sonora ser pouco rica, mas bem executada.

Recomendo fortemente para quem gosta de point and click.

19424180.review: Nice little Sci-Fi Adventure game, just over twice as long as your average movie and just as memorable. Worth every penny. Provided you value the effort these, oh so few, good indie game developers go to. Fine voice acting and bonus is you will get all the achievements easily (if that's how you choose to live your life)

19405202.review: It is a bit short but even when the plot going to be a bit cheesy on some places it have a god atmosphere and visual is also nice. Definitely thumbs up for intro and outro because I didn't expect that and somebody take care about that properly above expectations for that so small team. So it is a one evening pretty good sci-fi adventure game.

19368781.review:
Gut aber zu kurz und teuer

Ich persönlich war absolut zufrieden mit Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock. Das liegt aber auch daran, dass ich das Spiel als Bestandteil eines günstigen Bundle-Pakets erworben hatte und somit umgerechnet nur ein paar Cents für das Spiel zahlte. Die 9,99 € Steam-Standardpreis wären für ein 3-stündiges Indie-Spielchen, welches obendrein auf einem kostenlosen Flash-Game basiert, definitiv zu teuer gewesen! Schade eigentlich, denn abseits der grundsoliden Story mit ebenso grundsolidem Adventure-Gameplay, überzeugt der Titel mit einem überraschend hohem Komfort, welcher sogar neue Impulse ins Genre bringt. Wem die kurze Spieldauer nichts ausmacht, kann gerne einen halben Punkt zu meiner Gesamtwertung hinzuaddieren, aber auch so ist mir Descent to Deadrock noch eine gute Wertung wert.


Pro und Kontra:

Pro:
- grundsolides Gameplay mit fairem Schwierigkeitsgrad
- bietet überraschend hohen Komfort durch großzügige Hotspot-Trefferzonen, dauerhafte Speicherung freigelegter Hotspots und sehr flotter Fortbewegung zwischen den Szenenbildern
- nette Rendersequenzen für ein Indie-Adventure

Neutral:
- ist „nur“ ein Remastering eines kostenfreien Flash-Spiels. Wem die Präsentation eines Flash-Spiels genügt, kann sich den Kauf also sparen und stattdessen Newgrounds und Co. einen Besuch abstatten.
- die Story ist zwar spannend und motivierend aber auch recht ausgelutscht

Kontra:
- schlechtes Preis- Leistungsverhältnis (10 € für 3 Stunden Spielzeit)
- Powell's Synchronsprecher lässt zu wünschen übrig
- Renderbilder sind zu statisch
- bietet nur einen selbstständig speichernden Spielstand, der automatisch gelöscht wird, wenn man ein neues Spiel beginnt

19358991.review:
Short, but good fun!  If you're a fan of old-school point'n'click, and by that I mean a lot of "can I use this thing with this other thing" kind of gameplay, then this is worth your time and heck, it's cheap as chips right now.

The voice acting is kind of....eh....so I ended up clicking through most of it, but the story is engaging, nicely told and some of the little cutscenes are damn good.  Heck, some of the log entries actually made me go "Awww..." as I was playing.

So yeah, short (Like you could get through this in a couple of hours short) but worth the modest purchase price.

19327894.review:
This game definltey leans back to the days of the old point-and-click games, and that's a good thing. You can get a few hours out of this game, and none of it is particularly difficult. Showing a lot of love from the old-school point-and-click days, all of the backgrounds appear to be hand-painted, which only adds charm as far as I'm concerned. The inventory system is easy to use and you'll need to drag some items onto another item to create a new item. Not all of these combinations are obvious, so you might end up trying a few things; but none of it leads to frustration. 

The story itself isn't bad, but it feels like a lot of disjointed ideas that are thrown together. For example, one area shows an alien that's been stabbed to death in a hidden room and supposedly the body is still warm, meaning that it's a very recent murder. Nothing of this situation is ever resolved. The alien is never identified, the murderer is never revealed, the reason for the murder is never established, and there is nothing to link it with the rest of the story anyway. So, why bother introducing them in the first place? Also, human technology just so happens to be compatible with alien technology. That's quite a coincidence.

What made this game difficult to get through was the voice acting. Oh, dear God! It's by no means the worst I've ever heard, but that's not saying much. It's bad! "Reading lines while utterly bored" might be more appropriate.

Still, the artwork, the semblance of a story, and the throwback to the days of classic point-and-click gaming made this worth playing. You might want to turn the speech off, though.

19321108.review:
I really like this game. The premise is amazing, the visuals are amazing, and the game works flawlessly. I would love to give this game a positive review, but i can't for one reason- the price.
This game gives you almost nothing for your $10- 2 hours of gameplay at the most, because it has 0 replayability. I love the game, but you shouldn't have to pay that much for 2 hours. 
I would give this game an incredibly favorable review if the cost goes down 7 or 8 dollars, but before that, don't buy this game. Buy something that will give you more for your money.

18821515.review: Bardzo przyjemna i dość krótka ale wciągająca gra typu P&C. Animacji tu praktycznie brak za to są zagadki z logicznym rozwiązaniem i nie trzeba szukać wuja w śmietniku żeby coś włączyć czy przełączyć. Ma wciagającą fabułę i w zasadzie trzeba grać aż do końca, bo chce się towarzyszyć naszemu bohaterowi. Osobiście z otwartymi ramionami przywitałbym sequel. Jeśli ktoś grał w J.U.L.I.A to pewnie poczuje się jak w domu, jednak ten tytuł jest lepszy IMO. Polecam!

18803893.review: AMAZING game, But one grudge i have with it, Is that this game doesn't have a sequel, There were many questions, And i just want to know them, And go on more adventures with these characters.

18709198.review: This is actually a great point and click adventure game. I played it through in one sitting due to it's engrossing storyline and not known what would happen next. It is extremely atmospheric with eerie sounds and the locations are well drawn which gives you the overall feeling of being alone on a strange planet. The voice acting is very good too and suits the game well. Puzzles were a little convoluted at times but enjoyable enough and satisfying when you finally crack them. All in all,  I really enjoyed it and is well worth a few hours of anyone's time who enjoy this genre of games.

18693367.review:
Very simple, relaxing hidden object game. Mixed art assets - some very good, some poor - and decent audio with good enough voice acting. Probably about an hour to two hours of content, based on your skills at adventure games. I don't necessarily think I'd pay the full price on it, but I got it in a bundle and played through it in one sitting. I enjoyed the story for what it is - feels like they thought about the world, but it doesn't go too into detail beyond the scope of the game itself.

And then had to idle the game because it is shorter than the card drop threshold.

18685892.review:
A pretty decent game, I must say. A bit too short, which is a huge pity:  with straight-forward tasks bound by clear logic, it was a pleasure to work through. I wish more games were working like that, just letting the player do the logical things instead of hunting for the right point to click or making you do weird guesswork on weird stuff, like "J.U.L.I.A." (a similar point-and-click game about a crashed ship) does. Also, enjoyed the banter between the characters, although the captain seemed to me a bit too lively for a guy who just recently crash-landed while being impaled on a metal rode. But that's me.
All in all, I recommend this little game and would gladly buy a sequel if it comes out any time during my life span.

18353187.review: Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock to przygodowa gra typu point'n'click. W grze wcielamy się w astronautę Powella, który na skutek katastrofy kosmicznej znalazł się na tajemniczej planecie Deadrocku, a naszym zadaniem staje się znalezienie części niezbędnych do naprawy statku i powrotu do domu. Fabuła w Morningstar stoi na naprawdę niezłym poziomie. Odkrywanie mrocznych sekretów planety, z której nikt żywy jeszcze nie wrócił, jest naprawdę ciekawe i trzyma w napięciu aż do końca gry. Pod względem rozgrywki omawiany tytuł to typowy, pierwszoosobowy point & click, w którym za pomocą lewego przycisku myszy dokonujemy interakcji z obiektami na ekranie, zbieramy przedmioty, łączymy je i w ten sposób rozwiązujemy kolejne zagadki. I przyznam, że one również zostały wykonane bardzo przyzwoicie. Są logiczne i przemyślane. Nie należą raczej do zbyt trudnych, choć nad kilkoma z nich trzeba będzie dłużej pomyśleć. Nawet jeśli zdarzy się nam utknąć w jakimś miejscu, możemy liczyć na pomoc kapitana Novaka, drugiego ocalałego z katastrofy, który jednak został w niej unieruchomiony i przez radio pomaga nam wpaść na trop rozwiązań kolejnych zagadek. Oprawie audiowizualnej również nie można niczego zarzucić. Lokacje i obiekty zostały wymodelowane w trójwymiarze i wyglądają bardzo dobrze. A razem z nastrojową ścieżką dźwiękową świetnie budują niepokojący i lekko mroczny klimat Deadrocku. Jedyną rzeczą, do której można by się doczepić jest to, że Morningstar to produkcja krótka i przechodzi się ją w ponad dwie godziny, co pozostawia pewien niedosyt. Warto zauważyć, iż Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock to tak naprawdę nieco odświeżona wersja darmowej gry przeglądarkowej i kupowanie tytułu, w który można zagrać za darmo może powodować niesmak. Podsumowując, Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock to krótka, ale naprawdę dobra produkcja, oferująca ciekawą i wciągającą rozgrywkę z porządną oprawą audiowizualną. Zdecydowanie warto się z tym tytułem zapoznać, szczególnie, że jest też dostępny w wersji darmowej.

18351798.review: 这游戏，我记得，好早以前在4399上玩过 什么鬼

18350051.review: I really liked this point and click adventure. The voice work is a bit off but it's fun to play. Pretty much no story other than hey.. go here and here to get this so we can leave.  Good for a couple of hours of puzzle solving. I bought it for full price and have no problem with that.

18278922.review:
Cuando un juego que podias encontrar en una pagina de juegos flash llega a Steam, claramente es debido a que puede ser potencializado. 

Con mejores graficas, diseño, puzzles, nuevas escenas y una gran atmosfera, esta remasterizacion del 2015 fue una grata sorpresa. La contra es haberlo jugado antes. Pero al mismo tiempo, vale la pena. 

Un juego point and click que vale la pena tener, con una historia basada en un simple dialogo que hace llevadera la historia de dos marines espaciales que buscan salir del planeta donde estan atrapados.

Otra contra puede ser el precio. Pero eso depende del pais donde estes (en mi caso, 10 usd es demasiado dinero) y por la misma cantidad hay otros juegos que le hacen frente. Y mucho.

Sin embargo, si lo ven en rebaja, o lo ven en un bundle o quieren comprarlo, adelante. Lo recomiendo mucho.

8/10

18275757.review: If you like the genre, this is a fun example of it, and worth getting when it's discounted. However, it is quite short (100% completion in about 90 minutes), the ending feels rushed, and there's no real resolution to any of the mysteries, so I can't recommend it at full price - not when you can get something like the Time Gentlemen, Please! and Ben There, Dan That! Special Edition Double Pack for half the cost.

18259134.review: Fun little adventure game distraction. Took about an hour and a half to beat, but was quite enjoyable.

18230535.review:
I love this game!! The backdrop story is just full enough to keep you engaged without reading screens of history and lore, which is the tone through the game, just the right amount of everything. The puzzles were logical but required some out of the box thinking, a few items were of the "What the hell am I going to do with this?" type, but ended up making sense at the right time. 
Hints are easily provided (if needed) by your ever present captain, and made help/hints feel like a part of the game rather than a separate process, very nicely done.
Gameplay is point and click, graphics had a very realistic feel, cutscenes were well done, voice acting was good, not great, but not bad.
If you like sci-fi, spaceships, alien planets, mystery, big menacing machinery with unknown purposes and a good adventure, get this game!
The only negative is that it's not long enough!
Very nicely done, great entertainment value for the price.
Highly recommend!

18230060.review: Really enjoyed this game, great use of a subtle help system.

18118898.review:

18036012.review:
[b]Gameplay[/b]
Morningstar is pretty standard first-person point & click adventure. Think Myst but with simpler puzzles and lots of combining inventory items. Most of the time the puzzles take the right amount of thought to sort out, though it took me forever to figure one out. Another pre-supposed that you had an idea what went in to gunpowder, which I luckily did. There isn't really a way to fail or die though, so trial and error is safe and will get you through the game. Sometimes his hints seem to be so general as to not help you at all, however.

[b]Story[/b]
The story is written well enough to hold my interest for the 1.7 hours it took to beat, but the voice acting is somewhat amateurish. The main character is fine, but the only other voiced character, Novak, has an accent that swings from Swedish to Russian to Spanish, which can be irritating. 

[b]Overall[/b]
This is an ejoyable game with good story and somewhat dated graphics. 

If you're looking to buy it I'd wait for a sale; $10 seems a little steep for 1.7 hours of gameplay that you most likely won't repeat. I even got all the acheivements on the first playthrough. Maybe look for it to show up in a bundle, too. I think I got it from an IndieGala bundle.

17994872.review:
Short but beautiful. I liked this game since it was a tiny flash browser game.
I hope there will be some sort of sequel.

17921530.review: A point 'n click game with a "stranded-on-an-alien-planet" theme that has a somewhat underdeveloped story, but is enjoyable nonetheless.  All achievements easily attainable.

17918655.review: 3 heures suffiront pour en venir à bout, mais ce sont 3 heures bien investies. Le jeu est plutôt bien réalisé. Les énigmes sont en revanche un peu simplistes, mais on se plait à essayer tant bien que mal de se sortir de ce fichue deadrock. Merci à Ghylard pour la traduction française !

17909135.review:
A Morningstar jött, lezuhant, elvarázsolt, majd végül kiszabadult, hátrahagyva maga után egy kellemes játékot.
A történet viszonylagos egyszerűsége megfelelt, bár szomora maradt pár megválaszolatlan kérdés: Ki ölte meg az idegent? Mire kellett nekik az a nagy masina?
Az irányítás klasszikus point and click, tökéletesen működik. A fejtörők jól eltaláltak, logikai bunkfencet nem fedeztem fel bennük.
Egyetlen "nagy" problémám a játékkal, hogy bár magyar fejlesztőcsapat készítette, még sincsen hozzá (vagy csak nem találtam) magyar feliratot vagy szinkront :(
De egye fene a SÖR márkájú sör azért kártpótolt egy kicsit :p
Nagy piros pont a fejlesztőnek, sok sikert a továbbiakban.

17809052.review:
I liked this one. This game reminds me of a common HOG game without mini-games.

It's a casual point & click adventure game which can be finished in 2 hours. Story is OK and the graphics as well. There's a built-in hint system (radio) which holds your hand throughout the game.

100% achievements can be obtained easily, there's no need to play the game again, 99% of them are triggered by the story.

17787466.review: It's very short. It's also very accessible and wraps up neatly. If you're new to the genre, it's a good place to start. I'd like to compare it to fast food. It's quick and fulfilling but not remarkable. Nobody complains though.

17756195.review:
Very short, but interesting enough point and click adventure.
I finished it in 2.1(!) hours, admittedly I did consult a walkthrough, but only towards the end, when the puzzles got slightly abstract. That being said however, I expect that a more experienced point and click player would finish this game even without a walkthrough in less than 3 hours.

I got the game cheap and was well immersed in it, so I won't complain too much about the short game lenght.
Think of it as a movie, but instead of being a passive viewer you control the events (albeit linear) yourself.
To back that up, it even has a cheesy action ending :P

17732124.review:
Pleasing, simple, if short point & click game. Figure about 2 hours to complet + all achievements. 

Very nice artwork and a cool, not too over-dramatized atmosphere. Although you run across dead crew here and there, the game wasn't too gory and annoying, except maybe the captain's initial condition. 

The voice work ranges from very good to quite poor, usually it's quite good but it boggles me when a voice actor doesn't know which word receives emphasis in a phrase... I can only imagine it's a general lack of reading proclivity. It happens in many games with voiceovers and this one more than usual. Still, most of the time it's fine.

The puzzles are generally easy but fairly satisfying. It's mostly linear but you do get to roam a few locations sometimes to look around and try things. 

The rapport between the captain and protag is mostly good but a little cheesy at times. And a bit of animation on the captain woul have helped, it felt like you were talking to a painting at times. 

Anyway I enjoyed it and finished it in 2 sittings. There was only one poor puzzle part I got stuck on, the ventilator near the generator. 
But I can recommend this as a nice, short point & clicker.

17699886.review:
Morningstar is a first person adventure game that feels a lot like Journeyman Project, minus time travel and dialogue. You're crash landed on a desolate planet and need to figure out how to get back to space. You go from screen to screen like good ol' Myst, find items, logs and solve problems. It's a tad short, but it has a good flow to it when it comes to puzzles and level progression.

The prerendered backgrounds and animations are great, and everything is in high quality detail. The music and sound effects are also pretty sweet, but the voice acting is cringeworthy. The writing itself is okay, though. The setting is developed just enough to keep you going, but no questions are answered.

Apparently, there is a free Flash version of the game present on sites like Kongregate and Newgrounds, so you can try it there first. 9 Euros/Dollars for this might be a bit overpriced. If it was around 6 I feel like it would be more appropriate. (I can't complain, really, since I got it in a bundle.)

TL;DR
+ nice puzzles
+ decent setting
+ detailed art and sound
- bad voiceacting
- short

If you like adventures, give it a shot!

17668662.review:
The biggest problem with this game is that it's too short.
I liked it because of a good atmosphere and interesting story.
Puzzles are not as difficult as Myst..the ingame hint-system really helps you stay on track.

17638186.review:
I do enjoy a good point and click adventure game, but sometimes they get a little complicated and drag on. Morningstar's strength and weakness is its length. It sticks around long enough for you to not to get bored of it, but not long enough to answer any real questions about the story itself. I found this a little disheartening, because I found the story itself quite interesting throughout most of the game.

   The difficulty felt pretty balanced overall, but definitely had some hitches. I found myself lost on only two puzzles, one due to pixel hunting and another due to the game not explaining too well what items I was actually holding in my inventory. There is a 'Radio' option to help guide you towards your next goal, but is useless in providing hints.

[b] Overall: [/b] A good distraction for an afternoon, but not much else.

[b] Amount to Pay: [/b] About $2. I paid that for a bundle in which this was the only game I didn't have, and I don't regret it.

17634647.review:
Extrement court (+ou- 2Heure pour en voir la fin) mais plutôt intéressant et divertissant ! 
Les cut scenes ne casse pas trois pattes a un canard mais reste correct. 
Bref un petit point & clic sauce SF a faire si ont affectionne ce type de jeu/univers.

17634501.review:
[h1]Vesmírná adventura[/h1]
Hned zpočátku hry se spustí intro, kdy sledujete vaši vesmírnou loď, jak padá na pouštní planetu. Budete na to zírat a kvalita tohoto videa je opravdu na vysoké úrovni, díky čemuž vás hra už od prvních sekund pohltí. Brzy zjistíte, že pilot je zraněný a další člen posádky zemřel. Bude tedy na vás opravit loď a zachránit svého kámoše. Postupně během hry zjistíte, že na planetě je další loď ze Země a možná odhalíte i něco málo o zdejším mimozemském životu...

Příběh je tu skutečně výborný a i když mě vadila podstata onoho mimozemského života, nijak to výslednému dojmu neuškodilo. Jde to těžko popsat, ale během těch 2,5 hodin jsem se vážně cítil jako bych na té planetě byl [b]JÁ[/b] a snažil se z ní dostat.

Tímto se dostávám k postavám, které jsou, jak jsem již zmínil nahoře, pouze dvě. Dost často spolu komunikují a tím by se měl vytvářet nějaký vztah, ale celé t jejich tlachání o ničem mě přišlo až příliš moc natahované a místy tam dokonce byly i trapné dialogy. Jako chápu, že tu nejspíš nevadí nějaké to přátelské pošťuchování, ale čeho je moc, toho je příliš a pokud bych byl v jejich situaci, tak bych se nejspíš moc nechoval jako oni (myšleno ohledně dialogů).

[h1]O můj bože, budete už zticha?[/h1]
Jak jsem psal výše, dialogů je tu až příliš. Jemně to narušuje tu tajemnou atmosféru, kdy už už chcete hrát, ale hlavní dvě postavy najednou nechtějí odletět z téhle planety co nejdřív a místo toho by si povídali celé dny o všem možném.

Zde vyplouvá na povrch další zápor, a to kvalita dabingu. Není neposlouchatelný, ale zase není ani nějak extra povedený, takže takový zlatý střed. Hlavní postava má zpočátku hry takový toporný projev, skoro jako kdyby byla robot (což by byl zvrat! :D), ale od poloviny hry se to už tak nějak zlepší.

Jedním dechem ale dodávám, že naopak grafická stylizace a již zmíněná kvalita cutscén (jsou celkem 3) je na výši. Skvěle doplňují atmosféru a u některých prostředí budete jen zírat s pootevřenými ústy.

[h1]Trocha toho adventuření[/h1]
Co se týče adventurní části hry, je tak nějak „casual“. Nemám rád adventury. Nebaví mě, mnohdy jsou dost složité a brzy se v nich všechno zvrhne ve zkoušení každého předmětu na vše. Tady tohle díky bohu nehrozí.

Zpočátku mě překvapilo, jak je to tu uděláno - najedete myší na nějaký předmět nebo aktivní místo a kolem něj se vytvoří větší modrý čtverec, který  na obrazovce už zůstane. Díky tomu stačí proletět myší jen zhruba obrazovku a naleznete vše potřebné. Což je lepší než pixelhunting v ostatních adventurách.

Dalším neduhem her tohoto žánru je občas až nelogické kombinace předmětů nebo jejich využití, což tu nehrozí. I když... je tu jedna kombinace předmětů, která dle mého názoru působí tak nějak divně. Koho by napadlo, že aby vyhodil dveře do vzduchu, tak musí spojit taser, hodinky a provazový žebřík??? (ok, teď si nejsem jistý, jestli to byl žebřík, ale i tak je to šílená kombinace)

Na druhou stranu tohle byla asi jediná nelogická věc a mimochodem - systém nápovědy je tu opravdu parádní. Znáte ten problém, kdy se prostě zaseknete, ale nechcete vědět, jak dál, ale jen trochu postrčit? Tak přesně to tady je. Zmáčknete tlačítko Rádio a pilot prohodí větu, co by se mělo udělat nejdřív, na co by se hráč měl zaměřit atd. Takže nečekejte průvodce hrou, ale jen takové nakopnutí správným směrem.

Ještě bych se chtěl vrátit k předmětům, které shromažďujete v inventáři. Je jich moc. Strašně brzo budete mít inventář plný snad více jak deseti věcí a některé vám po svém využití zmizí, jiné zůstanou až do konce hry, aniž byste je vícekrát použili. Je to dle mě matoucí a měli to udělat tak, že by daný předmět zmizel, pokud by se už neměl uplatnění. Ale zase chápu, že by to dost ulehčilo hru. Navíc hlavní postava někdy vtipně komentuje použití špatného předmětu, takže se aspoň i trochu zasmějete.

[h1]A ještě nějaká ta kontroverze na závěr[/h1]
Hra stojí 10 euro a je dlouhá kolem 2-2,5 hodiny (možná i méně, já sám jsem se párkrát zasekl). Za tuhle cenu bych ji nemohl moc doporučit, ale pokud ji seženete za 5 euro a méně, tak se rozhodně vyplatí. Je tu ale ještě jedna věc. Jitřenka: Sestup na Mrtvou skálu (jak zní její název volně přeložený do češtiny), byla původem flash hra zadarmo na webu. A stále tam je. Verze vydaná na Steamu má několik vylepšení (grafika, dabing, zvuky, videa, achievementy, kartičky) a především jiný konec. I přes to ale myslím, že se vyplatí její koupě.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ atmosféra
+ příběh
+ hudba
+ grafika
+ tak akorát obtížnost
+ systém nápovědy

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- při plné ceně poměr délka/cena hry
- kvalita dabingu
- jednou nelogická kombinace předmětů
- postavy jsou až moc ukecané a dialogy polemizují občas na hranici trapnosti
- z tématu se dalo vytřískat víc (jen osobní výtka)

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 7/10[/b]

Jitřence jsem původně nedával moc naději, že by mě mohla zaujmout, ale nakonec se tak stalo a jsem rád, že jsem měl možnost si ji zahrát. Něco na tom je, nouzově přistát na cizí planetě a zjišťovat, že možná není tak opuštěná, jak jste si na začátku mysleli. Herní mechaniky jsou tu velkorysé i k nováčkům v žánru, což je obrovská výhoda. Za plnou cenu nemůžu doporučit, ale za polovinu a méně byste už o koupi rozhodně měli uvažovat.

Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock is a short compelling little point-and-click adventure from space following in the big steps of games aka The Dig. 
Gameplay wise it's a solid piece of work. You combine various objects which each other and find new and unconventional solutions to otherwise unsolvable problems 
Musically it's nice outerspace ambient sound..kinda. Very relaxed and subtle 7.5 of 10 because the could have dared more with the sounds and music. 
I don't want to spoil to much, but seasoned adventure gamers won't be surprised by the story. But the first-person view adds some new element and the solutions are sometimes quite unexpected.
Overall I would recommend it to all of you adventure gamers looking for something new for a decent price.

The graphics are way better and are updated perfectly, but it still keeps the feel of the old flash game. The cutscenes are really cinematic unlike the original. They have also additionally added around an extra 20 minutes of gameplay with an extra objective with new puzzles. There is also decent voice acting that is included. 16403422.review:
My first IBM-PC game ever was Monkey Island. The original, good, old (MS-DOS days), humorous Lucas Arts point-and-click adventure game. My first CD-ROM game was "Star Trek TNG: A Final Unity". Another point-and-click adventure. While these kind of adventure games are not my favorite genre, they are part of what computers games were and still are. They are a part of history, and when a great game of this kind comes along, like Morningstar, then it has to be played.

This one is really a good one. People are complaining about the price tag, and that it should technically be free, because it exists as flash game. I strongly disagree. This is a beautifully crafted game, that works similar to one of the popular interactive movies from the 1990s, with stronger puzzle elements. You definitely have to think about how to solve a problem, and having some basic understanding of technology certainly helps. It's never too difficult, and usually the provided hints, if at all necessary, are more than sufficient.

In particular the part of the game towards the end is very well done, and even if the story is not your thing, and even if you don't like adventure games at all, you should give this shot, purely for the visuals. It's a short game, but quality definitely trumps over quantity here.

	Morningstar; Descent to Dearock is a sci-fi point and click adventure where you play as the survivor of a ship that has crashed onto a planet.  While there is no time limit to the game, the atmosphere conveys a need to progress through in order to escape as soon as possible.  The voice acting is pretty bad, making it hard to push through, but as you play through the game, there is less dialogue making it easier to stomach the farther you get in the game.  

	The story is decent, and does a good job of connecting you to the character that you pay as, but it is the gameplay that makes this game worth playing. You need to find items as you progress through the world and combine these items in different ways in order to progress forward. It doesn't feel like a scavenger hunt, as so many adventure games do.  The game didn't hold my hand as I went through, but it did use  puzzles and items in such a way that I had to use my brain, and work to solve the problems (even through the hint system is tied well into the story and doesn't make you feel like a cheater). This made me feel more like the character that was portrayed rather than some 3rd party player, thus why it may of added to the difficulty at times, but this also help set a stronger atmosphere. 

	The game was solid and sensible, and I enjoyed playing this game despite its few flaws.

This is a summary of my review video, which I encourage you to watch
if you are looking for a more in-depth review.

14884960.review:
[b]Rose Tinted[/b]

I've always had a soft spot for Point and Click adventure games, they take me back to an earlier time in my gaming career when I could sit down in front of the latest Lucasarts game and lose myself with Loom, Full Throttle or Monkey Island.

My rose tinted view of these old classics tends to forget the ridiculously convoluted inventory puzzles that made up a large part of the problem solving mechanic in these games.


[b]Random Combinations[/b]

You remember those frustrating puzzles where you'd find yourself spending hours combining items  in your inventory at random to try and figure out what on earth you're supposed to do next.

This isn't a problem you're likely to encounter in Morningstar, A point and click sci-fi adventure developed by Red Herring Labs.


[b]It's Logical Captain[/b]

The puzzles here are entertaining and logical,  if you put a little thought into each problem you encounter here (which are mostly about finding parts and fixing machinery) then you're unlikely to find yourself stuck for too long without having to resort to the "I don't know why I'm trying to combine these items" tactic that was required in the old school titles.


[b]Scanning for Pixels[/b]

There aren't  really any hidden object puzzles to  worry about  either, everything item you'll need should be fairly apparent to you as you move your mouse around the screen. There are no frustrating pixel hunts to stress you out.

This simplistic approach is  quite refreshing and  allows you to focus on the titles main selling point, the story.


[b]A Tale With Impact[/b]

Descent to Deadrock tells a compelling and mysterious tale.

The game opens with your ship crashing onto a seemingly barren desert planet. There are only two survivors, the ships captain  "Novak" and You!
Novak, like the ship itself, is in a bad  way following the crash, so it's  going to be down to you to find the items you'll need to try and repair the ship and hopefully escape the planet.

Along the way you'll scratch the surface of some of the mysteries Deadrock keeps.
Don't expect full disclosure though, Deadrock holds its secrets tightly and your main goal here is to escape the planet, there will be unanswered questions after you complete this game.


[b]Finish Him[/b]

And complete it you will... 
It's the strong intriguing story that'll keep  you playing though the couple of hours required to complete Morning Star.
You'll probably finish it in one sitting, which isn't necessarily a  bad thing.
There's a lot to be said for a bite sized, focused tale that completes its story arc in two hours.
A movie gives us a couple of hours entertainment and that is exactly what you'll get here, two hours of sci-fi mystery interspersed with some exploration and problem solving.


[b]Static Atmosphere[/b]

Based on an old flash game, this outing of Morningstar presents itself mostly as static screens where you'll be searching for and using items to either fix machinery or get past obstacles.
These static visuals are nothing if not atmospheric, the stillness in each location creates a sense of tension and isolation as you explore your crashed ship and later the surrounding area of Deadrock.
Due to all this stillness, when animation is used, it has a much greater impact than you'd imagine.

There are also some cut scenes, not many, but they are very effective in pulling you into the moment, I just wish there were more of them.


[b]Did you hear that...[/b]

The game is fully voiced, and whilst the voice acting isn't going to win any awards, it is competent enough to keep the story moving forward without breaking the immersion.


[b]Going Down?[/b]

Should you get Morningstar: Descent to Deadrock?

That depends on what you're looking for in a point and click adventure game.

If you're looking for an epic, sweeping tale to lose yourself in for weeks, challenging puzzles and state of the art cut scenes, then no, Morningstar isn't that game.

However, if you're looking to invest a couple of hours in an enigmatic sci-fi setting, enjoy some thoughtful but not too challenging puzzles and be entertained in an encapsulated narrative experience, then you could do a lot worse than spend an evening with Morningstar.

( To view the full review (and others) please take the time to visit [url]http://www.review-well.com/ [/url] )

I can honestly say I was thinking about playing the original Morningstar game, when the title of the tituar game came accross my screen.

Sure enough, Morningstar: Descent To Deadrock is a complete HD remake of the original 2009 flash game, but fear not, it's not the same game with prettier graphics, oh no, Morningstar-DTD has added over 30 minutes of new gameplay, complete with a new and exciting ending.

Sure enough, you play as 'Powell' a crew-member of the Morningstar space-ship, which hits (literrally) a bit of a problem in the shape of crash-landing on a forbidden and mysterious planet (also nicknamed 'Deadrock). 

As the only guy who's either alive or not impaled, it's up to Powell's job to fix the ship and explore this seemingly dead planet......which may not be so dead afterall! 

I'm not sure whether the game's creators employed the same voice-artists from the original game, but they've done a fairly satisfying job.

The graphics are nice and so is the interface, though admittedly i did have to consult the walkthrough on a few occassions....but most of the time, the slightly impaled Captain Novak can offer words of assistance and encouragement via the radio.

Overall, Morningstar-DTD is a fine remake and makes me long for a sequel or at least more explaination about the mysterious the 'Deadrock' holds, but for almost 3 hours of gameplay for a small price, I was quite delighted.

So.......sequel please.......pretty please, with beer on top?!

14647958.review:
http://niveloculto.com/analisis-morningstar-descent-deadrock/

Hay una cosa importante a tener en cuenta cuando hablamos de Morningstar – Descent to Deadrock. Es el remake HD de un juego que salió hace años en Flash. Siento un gran respeto por la comunidad que durante años estuvo subiendo sus juegos flash, y me parece alucinante lo que algunos de ellos lograron (Alien Hominid, o este primer Morningstar). Teniendo esto presente, me parece una barbaridad el salto que han logrado dar desde Red Herring Labs, pasando de la versión inicial a esta que presentan bajo la distribución de Phoenix Online Studios.

Nada más empezar nuestra nave se estrellará en el planeta Deadrock, una bola de roca llena de vacío y penurias que toda persona con cabeza procura evitar. Encarnaremos a Powell, del que no nos queda clara la profesión, que es el único miembro de la tripulación que puede intentar resolver la papeleta: el capitán yace herido, empalado por una barra de hierro, y el ingeniero ha muerto por un fallo en su cámara de hibernación. Con semejante panorama la prioridad será salir de la sala en la que estamos atrapados y ganar acceso al resto de la nave.

Una vez empezamos a resolver los primeros puzles del juego es cuando empezamos a entender lo que sus desarrolladores quieren darnos. Porque tenemos por delante una aventura gráfica de las de antes, en primera persona, con énfasis en el uso de objetos para seguir adelante y con escenarios fijos con los que interactuar. ¿Y qué es lo que nos quieren dar, bajo ese envoltorio? Un videojuego sencillo y honesto.

Porque una tendencia odiosa que existe en muchas aventuras gráficas, especialmente cuando quieren alargar artificalmente la duración, es la de utilizar puzles nefastos, de los que cabrean al jugador y le hacen buscar algo de esperanza en el terrible mundo de Youtube (sigo prefiriendo las guías en texto, sí). Morningstar tiene la candidez de darnos puzles que, aún requiriendo que pensemos, tienen una lógica aplastante y justificación dentro de la historia. Cuenta, además, con la opción de hablar por radio con Novak (el capitán), que nos dará pistas si nos atascamos (aunque esto sí lo desaconsejo, porque casi resuelve las cosas por uno). Especial mención a una serie de momentos en los que tendremos que aprender un pequeño alfabeto y relacionarlo con sistemas planetarios, un puzle brillante.

La otra pata que sustenta a Morningstar es el planeta en el que hemos acabado contra nuestra voluntad. Una de las propuestas del equipo de desarrollo era crear una experiencia atmosférica, y, a mi juicio, lo han conseguido. Cuando conseguimos abandonar la nave y adentrarnos en Deadrock, notamos una soledad palpable y casi angustiosa. Metros y más metros de desierto por delante, sin una triste señal de vida propia salvo de los desdichados que nos han precedido en el naufragio estelar. Formaciones de roca que nos ignoran mientras el silencio nos rodea, con un fantástico diseño de escenarios que a veces tienen hasta un aire majestuoso.

Por otra parte, me gusta cómo se dibuja la trama del juego. Se acerca a la ciencia ficción clásica, con ese planeta que realmente guarda más de lo que esperamos, pero también tiene la decencia de guardarse sus mejores secretos y no joder nada liándose a dar explicaciones. A lo largo de sus dos horas logrará mantenernos en tensión y acrecentar la preocupación por lo que nos puede llegar si nos quedamos en Deadrock y cuando lleguemos al final acabaremos sintiendo alivio. Habremos seguido una ruta natural espoleados por nuestro ingenio, sin acciones estrambóticas y con varios momentos para el recuerdo. Y aunque el doblaje (en inglés) es mejorable, también las escasas conversaciones con Novak resultan satisfactorias, sin tener que forzar una relación que no tiene por qué haber.

Últimamente, el sector está instalado en la tontísima polémica de la duración de los videojuegos. Motivo de más para hablar de Morningstar: como ya he dicho, dura no más de dos horas, y es una duración perfecta. Le da tiempo para fascinarnos por el escenario, para ponernos en tensión y para contarnos una historia sin artefactos estúpidos que la prolonguen y le hagan perder impacto. Precisamente, creo que el hecho de ser un título sencillo le da aún más valor y sirve para ejemplificar ese “menos es más” que desde aquí reclamamos.

Pero déjenme hablar de una última cosa.

Soy partidario de que a cada videojuego hay que valorarlo por separado, pero creo que la labor del remake ha sido impresionante. Han creado, prácticamente, un juego nuevo, rehecho desde cero, con unos escenarios preciosos, una banda sonora que acompaña bien y unas escenas de vídeo muy meritorias (atentos al final). Eso hay que valorarlo, aunque lo mejor de Morningstar seguirá siendo la honestidad con la que está hecho.

Si eres fan de la ciencia ficción o de los point & click y no tienes problemas con la duración, lo vas a disfrutar.
